name: NPR
text:
This year's pilgrimage to the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe was canceled, so one church put a portrait of Our Lady on a truck.

"This year instead of the people going on pilgrimage to the mother, it is the mother who goes on pilgrimage to her people."
https://t.co/77vpU3cv7C

name: NPR
text: Vaccines are en route. An executive with UPS told NPR about the complicated and challenging journey. https://t.co/gbwWOajg0i

name: NPR
text:
The piece begins: "Madame First Lady — Mrs. Biden — Jill — kiddo." 
Backlash was swift. https://t.co/Dz3QJR1xIh

name: NPR
text:
Using only the letters in RIDE ON — repeating them as often as necessary — you can spell:

1) the one-word proper name of a famous fictional animal, and 

2) a word for what kind of animal it is. 

What's the name of the animal, and what's the word?
https://t.co/qNlFfNEkyA

name: NPR
text:
Go ahead and take that nap.

 "A 20 minute nap can make up for one hour of lost sleep," a sleep researcher says. (From our archive) https://t.co/j2aGBuExPI

name: NPR
text:
Say yes to that second s'more and dressing like an onion when socializing outdoors. 

The art of weathering winter isn't just about nailing the gear. It's also about mindset. 

In Norway, there's a long tradition called friluftsliv: "free, outdoor life." https://t.co/Ol6vi0gAiw
